title: 2021 Dar es Salaam shooting
text:
On 25 August 2021, a gunman <a href="spree%20shooting">opened fire at two locations</a> in <a href="Dar%20es%20Salaam">Dar es Salaam</a>, <a href="Tanzania">Tanzania</a>. He initially killed two <a href="police%20officer">police officer</a>s at an <a href="intersection%20%28road%29">intersection</a> and stole the officers' <a href="rifle">rifle</a>s. He walked several hundred metres to the French <a href="embassy">embassy</a>, where he killed another officer and a <a href="security%20guard">security guard</a>. The gunman also injured six other people, before being shot dead by police.
On 2 September 2021, authorities confirmed that the attacker, identified as Hamza Mohamed, was motivated by <a href="Islamic%20extremism">Islamic extremism</a>. Prior to the shooting, he visited <a href="social%20media">social media</a> pages related to the <a href="Islamic%20State%20of%20Iraq%20and%20the%20Levant">Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant</a>.
References.
